arm_group.arm_group_label: Fentanyl IV PCA and placebo TAP catheter
arm_group.description: Patients will receive Fentanyl IV PCA and placebo TAP catheter.

arm_group.arm_group_label: TAP catheter with continuous infusion of Ropivicaine
arm_group.description: Patients will receive TAP catheter with continuous infusion of Ropivicaine for up to 48 hours after surgery.

brief_summary.textblock:
Up to 174 patients undergoing renal transplantation will be randomized to one of two groups.
       Randomization will be based on computer-generated codes using random block sizes ranging
      from 4 to 8.

      Group 1:   TAP catheter with continuous infusion of Ropivicaine Group 2:   Fentanyl IV PCA

      The TAP catheter will be removed 48 hours postoperatively. Following removal, the pain
      scores will be assessed at 60 and 72 hours postoperatively to determine any prolonged
      analgesic benefit.  In addition, the presence of any pain at the incision site will be noted
      at the 1 month surgical follow-up to determine any evidence of chronic pain.

      The investigators hypothesis is that unilateral kidney transplant patients with a continuous
      TAP catheter will have decreased pain scores and opioid usage compared to those receiving
      standard analgesic therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Continuous Transversus Abdominis Plane (TAP) Catheters on Postoperative Pain After Renal Transplantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The patient is >18 years of age

          -  The patient has provided written informed consent and understands the explanation of
             the protocol.

          -  The patient is scheduled to have a unilateral renal transplant with a flank incision

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients aged <18.

          -  Patients with a known allergy to amide local anesthetics or para-aminobenzoic acid.

          -  Patients who are unable to understand the verbal analog pain scale.

          -  Patients who decline participation.

          -  Patients with a midline abdominal incision.

          -  Combined transplants, ie. Kidney-pancreas

intervention.arm_group_label: TAP catheter with continuous infusion of Ropivicaine
intervention.description: Patients will receive TAP catheter with continuous infusion of Ropivicaine.

intervention.arm_group_label: Fentanyl IV PCA and placebo TAP catheter
intervention.description: Patients will receive placebo TAP catheter with Fentanyl IV PCA.
intervention.intervention_name: Fentanyl IV PCA and placebo TAP catheter

primary_outcome.description: The primary objective is to evaluate the influence of a continuous TAP analgesia on postoperative analgesia (as defined by pain scores and opioid requirements) in patients undergoing renal transplantation, compared to standard analgesic management (IV PCA).
primary_outcome.measure: Effect of continuous TAP analgesia and pain scores
